titlestmt.titleproper: Register to The Seymour Shifrin Papers
titlestmt.author: Compiled by Sandra Wehner

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday April 23, 2019 at 00:13

did.abstract: Music, correspondence and other papers, photographs, and additional materials by and about the American composer and educator Seymour Shifrin (1926-1979)

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The Papers are open to researchers by appointment. There are no restricted materials in the collection. Please contact the Special Collections staff to schedule an appointment.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The Seymour Shifrin Papers were established in the Music Library of Yale University by Miriam L. Shifrin in 1982.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Seymour Shifrin Papers are the physical property of the Irving S. Gilmore Music Library of Yale University. Copyrights belong to the composers and authors, or their legal heirs and assigns.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: MSS 36, The Seymour Shifrin Papers in the Irving S. Gilmore Music Library of Yale University.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: In 9 series as follows: I. Music. II. Correspondence. III. Programs. IV. Clippings. V. Writings. VI. Biographical material. VII. Manuscripts given to Shifrin by Roger Sessions. VIII. Miscellaneous items. IX. Musical instruments.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Seymour Shifrin Papers contain sketches, manuscript scores, and published editions of Shifrin's musical compositions, including orchestral works, chamber music, keyboard pieces, choral music, and songs. The Papers also hold autograph manuscripts of Roger Sessions' sonatas for unaccompanied violin and for piano. Seymour and Miriam Shifrin's correspondence includes letters to and from performers, composers, publishers, musical organizations, and family members. Shifrin's life and work are further documented by: programs; newspaper and magazine clippings; papers, addresses, and essays written by Shifrin; photographs; and musical instruments.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Seymour Jack Shifrin was born in Brooklyn, New York on February 28, 1926. After graduating from the New York High School of Music and Art, he studied privately with the composer William Schuman, and then attended Columbia University, where he received the BA and the MA in 1947 and 1949, respectively. His principal composition teacher at Columbia was Otto Luening. Shifrin taught at Columbia in 1949-1950 and at the City College of New York in 1950-51. The next year, he studied in Paris with Darius Milhaud. In 1952 he was appointed to the faculty of the University of California at Berkeley, where he remained until 1966, when he became a professor at Brandeis University.

Shifrin's works have been performed by many prominent ensembles and soloists, including the Boston Symphony Orchestra, the Minneapolis Symphony Orchestra, the Juilliard, Fine Arts, and Galimir Quartets, and Alfred Brendel, Stephen Bishop, Bethany Beardslee, and Jan de Gaetani. He received numerous honors, including the Boston Symphony's Horblit Award, as well as grants from the National Endowment for the Arts, the National Institute of Arts and Letters, and the Koussevitzky, Guggenheim, and Fulbright foundations.
Seymour Shifrin died in Boston on September 26, 1979, at the age of 53.

odd.head: General
odd.p: The music series of the Shifrin papers includes holograph, manuscript, and published music by Shifrin. This series is divided into six subseries (A-F) by genre. An index gives access by title. Cross references have been made from parts of works to the title under which they are being described. Transcription of the title page is given only when it contains information not stated in the uniform title. The first entry under a uniform title contains the fullest description. The date is noted only in the first entry unless it varies. Subseries A-E are arranged alphabetically by title. The subseries A (Student Works) contains works written from 1943-1946 while Shifrin was a student.

Items are arranged in boxes chronologically by date of composition. The folders are numbered consecutively throughout the entire series. There is one known work by Shifrin not contained in this collection, which is "Waltz" dating from 1977.

odd.head: General
odd.p: The correspondence series of the Shifrin papers includes holograph and typescript letters to Shifrin, by Shifrin and members of his family, and condolence letters to his wife, Miriam Shifrin. This series is divided into eight subseries (A-H) by subject. The subseries F (Universities) and H (Miscellaneous) are arranged chronologically within each subdivision. All other subseries (A-E and G) are arranged alphabetically by correspondent or subject.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Includes music written for Ted Shifrin.

did.unittitle: National Institute of Arts and Letters

Correspondence - Performers and Various Musical Organizations

odd.head: General
odd.p: This series contains programs from concerts including works by Shifrin and concerts given by his friends. The series is divided into two subseries. Subseries A (Concerts Including Shifrin Works) is arranged alphabetically by composition within the following subdivisions: Songs (and other vocal), Orchestral and Chamber Music, Keyboard Works, Choral Works, and More than one work. Subseries B (Concerts by Friends) is arranged alphabetically by performer or subject.

odd.head: General
odd.p: This series contains newspaper and magazine clippings concerning Shifrin and his friends. All have been photocopied onto acid-free paper and the originals were not kept. There are five subseries. Subseries A (Shifrin's Works and Performances) is arranged alphabetically within the same subdivisions used in Series IV: PROGRAMS. Subseries B-E are arranged in chronological order.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Includes typescript transcription of three reviews.

odd.head: General
odd.p: The writings of Shifrin contain holograph and typescript reports and essays, student notebooks and exercises, and program notes on his music. The series is divided into five subseries. The first three (A-C) are arranged chronologically and the last two (D-E) are arranged alphabetically by title. Subseries A (Student Years) contains material written before 1944. Subseries B (Columbia Years) contains material written from 1944-1948.

did.unittitle: Manuscripts given to Shifrin by Roger Sessions

odd.head: General
odd.p: This series contains two pieces of music given to Shifrin while Shifrin was teaching at the University of California at Berkeley. Included are Sessions' Sonata for unaccompanied violin and the Sonata for piano, which is incomplete.

did.unittitle: [Sonata, violin] Sonata for violin (unaccompanied) / Roger Sessions

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photocopy of holograph, with additions in ink.
Title page bears inscription from Sessions to Seymour Shifrin.
On title page: To Robert Gross.
Two additional photocopies of 4th movement laid in.

did.unittitle: [From my diary] Pages from a diary / Roger Sessions

odd.head: General
odd.p: Dates at end of each movement: I. (Princeton, 1937 May-1939 Nov.) -- II. (Colorado Springs, 1939 Aug.-Princeton, 1940 Mar.) -- III. (Colorado Springs, 1939 Aug.)
Incomplete. Lacks pp. 4-7 and pp. 13 to end.
Formerly listed in this register as a piano sonata, this piece was identified in 2006 by the Sessions scholar Andrea Olmstead as "Pages from a diary," later published under the title "From my diary."

odd.head: General
odd.p: This series contains three subseries. Subseries A (Photographs) contains photographs of Shifrin and his immediate family. Subseries B (Memorabilia) is arranged alphabetically by title or supplied title and contains address books, diplomas, passports, and other memorabilia. Subseries C (Notes by Susan Blaustein) contains notes written while Susan Blaustein prepared the initial organization of the papers.

did.unittitle: Photographs of Shifrin and his family.
Passports for Seymour Shifrin and his wife

odd.head: General
odd.p: This series contains a description of percussion instruments owned by Shifrin, some of which were made by him for use in his compositions. The instruments are arranged alphabetically by type (classification) of percussion instrument. Those instruments intended for use in a specific composition by Shifrin have been so identified.
